title: Old Master Drawings from Chatsworth
description: This exhibit held 114 Old Master Drawings from the Devonshire Collection at Chatsworth, all of which were brand new to U.S. audiences who would not have seen the otherwise private collection which held treasures such drawings, prints, and manuscripts. The collection was largely gathered by the Duke of Devonshire, William Cavendish. Among the artists represented in the exhibit were Leonardo da Vinco, Raphael, Mantgena, Rembrandt, Veronese, Rubens, Holbein, Durer, and Van Dyck
